required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Long- Term Effects of Spiriva on Lung Function in COPD Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel Group Trial Assessing the Rate of Decline of Lung Function With Tiotropium 18 mcg Inhalation Capsule Once Daily in Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD).

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this trial is to determine whether daily treatment with tiotropium (Spiriva®, Bromuro de Tiotropio®) inhalation capsule via HandiHaler® reduces the rate of decline in lung function over time in patients with COPD.

primary_outcome.measure: Pre-bronchodilator Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Rate of Decline From Day 30 to 4 Years
primary_outcome.description: Rate of decline of forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) measured before the use of bronchodilators. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing FEV1 over time, while a positive value indicates increasing FEV1.

primary_outcome.measure: Post-bronchodilator Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Rate of Decline From Day 30 to 4 Years
primary_outcome.description: Rate of decline of forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) measured after bronchodilation. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing FEV1 over time, while a positive value indicates increasing FEV1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-bronchodilator Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Rate of Decline From Day 1 to 30 Days After Completion of Double Blinded Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to 30 days after completion of double blinded treatment between Day 1 and 4 years plus 30 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of decline of forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) measured before the use of bronchodilators. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing FEV1 over time, while a positive value indicates increasing FEV1

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-bronchodilator Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Rate of Decline From Day 1 to 30 Days After Completion of Double Blinded Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to 30 days after completion of double blinded treatment between Day 1 and 4 years plus 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of decline of forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) measured after the use of bronchodilators. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing FEV1 over time, while a positive value indicates increasing FEV1

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-bronchodilator Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) Rate of Decline From Day 30 to 4 Years
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of decline of forced vital capacity (FVC) measured before the use of bronchodilators. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing FVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing FVC

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-bronchodilator Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) Rate of Decline From Day 30 to 4 Years
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of decline of forced vital capacity (FVC) measured after bronchodilation. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing FVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing FVC

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-bronchodilator Slow Vital Capacity (SVC) Rate of Decline From Day 30 to 4 Years
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of decline of slow vital capacity (SVC) measured before the use of bronchodilators. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing SVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing SVC

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-bronchodilator Slow Vital Capacity (SVC) Rate of Decline From Day 30 to 4 Years
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of decline of slow vital capacity (SVC) measured after bronchodilation. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing SVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing SVC

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Decline of St George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: SGRQ total score shows the impact of COPD on patient's health status, and expressed as a percentage of impairment with scale from 0 (best health status) to 100 (worst possible status). A negative rate of decline shows decreasing SGRQ total score (or improved health) over time, while a positive value shows increasing score (or worsen health).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-bronchodilator Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) Rate of Decline From Day 1 to 30 Days After Completion of Double Blinded Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to 30 days after completion of double blinded treatment between Day 1 and 4 years plus 30 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of decline of forced vital capacity (FVC) before bronchodilation. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing FVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing FVC

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-bronchodilator Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) Rate of Decline From Day 1 to 30 Days After Completion of Double Blinded Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to 30 days after completion of double blinded treatment between Day 1 and 4 years plus 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of decline of forced vital capacity (FVC) after bronchodilation. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing FVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing FVC

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-bronchodilator Slow Vital Capacity (SVC) Rate of Decline From Day 1 to 30 Days After Completion of Double Blinded Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to 30 days after completion of double blinded treatment between Day 1 and 4 years plus 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of decline slow vital capacity (SVC) before bronchodilation. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing SVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing SVC

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-bronchodilator Slow Vital Capacity (SVC) Rate of Decline From Day 1 to 30 Days After Completion of Double Blinded Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to 30 days after completion of double blinded treatment between Day 1 and 4 years plus 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of decline of slow vital capacity (SVC) after bronchodilation. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing SVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing SVC

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Exacerbation
secondary_outcome.description: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) exacerbation

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Exacerbations Per Patient Year
Number and Percentage of Patients With at Least One Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Exacerbation
Number of Exacerbation Days Per Patient Year
secondary_outcome.description: Number of exacerbation days normalized by treatment exposure

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First COPD Exacerbation Leading to Hospitalization (for 25% Patients)
Number and Percentage of Patients With at Least on COPD Exacerbation Leading to Hospitalization
Number of Exacerbation Leading to Hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Estimated number of exacerbations leading to hospitalizations per patient year

secondary_outcome.measure: Days of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Exacerbation Leading to Hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) exacerbation leading to hospitalization (normalized by treatment exposure)

Estimated St George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Total Score at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: SGRQ total score summarizes the impact of COPD on overall patient's health status. Total scores are expressed as a percentage of overall impairment where 100 represents worst possible health status and 0 indicates best possible health status. The scale is continuous. Rate of decline shows the yearly change of SGRQ total score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number and Percentage of Participants With All Cause Death and Time to Event Analysis (On-treatment)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to completion of double blinded treatment plus 30 days between Day 1 and 4 years plus 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: On-treatment defined as day 1 to completion of double blinded treatment plus 30 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Number and Percentage of Participants With All Cause Death (Including Vital Status Follow-up, Cutoff at 1470 Days)
secondary_outcome.description: All cause mortality vital status information was followed-up after discontinuation; vital status information up to 1470 days after the start of treatment was used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number and Percentage of Participants With Lower Respiratory Death (On-treatment; Adjudicated Primary Cause)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to completion of double blinded treatment plus 30 days between Day 1 and 4 years plus 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: The primary cause of death was adjudicated by an external committee prior to unblinding; on-treatment defined as day 1 to completion of double blinded treatment plus 30 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Number and Percentage of Participants With a Lower Respiratory Death (Adjudicated; Including Vital Status Follow-up, Cutoff at 1470 Days)
secondary_outcome.description: The primary cause of death was adjudicated by an external committee prior to unblinding; vital status was information followed-up after discontinuation; vital status information up to 1470 days after the start of treatment was used

other_outcome.measure: Incidence Rate of Serious Adverse Event (System Organ Class = Cardiac Disorders)
other_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to completion of double blinded treatment plus 30 days
other_outcome.description: Descriptive statistics show the number of patients with event, central tendency shows incidence rate. Incidence rate calculated as number of patients with event divided by at-risk years * 100.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written informed consent.
- Male or female patients 40 years of age or older.
- Smoking history of at least 10 pack years.
- Diagnosis of COPD with post bronchodilator FEV1 less than or equal to 70% of predicted normal and FEV1<70% of FVC and on stable respiratory medication.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Significant diseases other than COPD which in the opinion of the investigator may put the patient at risk or influence the patients ability to participate.
- Myocardial infarction in past 6 months.
- Unstable or life threatening arrhythmia in past year.
- Hospitalization for NYHA heart failure class III or IV in past year.
- Active tuberculosis.
- Asthma.
- Pulmonary resection.
- Malignancy treated with radiation or chemotherapy in past 5 years.
- Respiratory infection in 4 weeks prior to screening.
- Known hypersensitivity to anticholinergic drugs or components.
- Known moderate to severe renal impairment.
- Known narrow angle glaucoma.
- Significant symptomatic BPH or bladder neck obstruction.
- Need for oxygen therapy >12 hr/day.
- Use of oral corticosteroids at unstable doses or >10 mg/day.

measure.title: Age
Gender

outcome.title: Pre-bronchodilator Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Rate of Decline From Day 30 to 4 Years
outcome.description: Rate of decline of forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) measured before the use of bronchodilators. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing FEV1 over time, while a positive value indicates increasing FEV1.

measure.title: Pre-bronchodilator Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Rate of Decline From Day 30 to 4 Years
measure.description: Rate of decline of forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) measured before the use of bronchodilators. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing FEV1 over time, while a positive value indicates increasing FEV1.

analysis.estimate_desc: Arbitrary covariance matrix; fixed treatment effect; individual patients are random; rate of decline estimated as the slope of the random effects model

outcome.title: Rate of Decline of St George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Total Score
outcome.description: SGRQ total score shows the impact of COPD on patient's health status, and expressed as a percentage of impairment with scale from 0 (best health status) to 100 (worst possible status). A negative rate of decline shows decreasing SGRQ total score (or improved health) over time, while a positive value shows increasing score (or worsen health).

measure.title: Rate of Decline of St George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Total Score
measure.description: SGRQ total score shows the impact of COPD on patient's health status, and expressed as a percentage of impairment with scale from 0 (best health status) to 100 (worst possible status). A negative rate of decline shows decreasing SGRQ total score (or improved health) over time, while a positive value shows increasing score (or worsen health).

analysis.estimate_desc: Arbitrary covariance matrix; fixed treatment effect; individual patients are random; rate of decline estimated as the slope of the random effects model

outcome.title: Pre-bronchodilator Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) Rate of Decline From Day 1 to 30 Days After Completion of Double Blinded Treatment
outcome.description: Rate of decline of forced vital capacity (FVC) before bronchodilation. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing FVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing FVC
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to 30 days after completion of double blinded treatment between Day 1 and 4 years plus 30 days.

measure.title: Pre-bronchodilator Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) Rate of Decline From Day 1 to 30 Days After Completion of Double Blinded Treatment
measure.description: Rate of decline of forced vital capacity (FVC) before bronchodilation. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing FVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing FVC

analysis.method_desc: Rate calculated as (measure on 30days after completion of treatment - measure on day 1 )/ years in between

outcome.title: Post-bronchodilator Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) Rate of Decline From Day 1 to 30 Days After Completion of Double Blinded Treatment
outcome.description: Rate of decline of forced vital capacity (FVC) after bronchodilation. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing FVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing FVC
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to 30 days after completion of double blinded treatment between Day 1 and 4 years plus 30 days

measure.title: Post-bronchodilator Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) Rate of Decline From Day 1 to 30 Days After Completion of Double Blinded Treatment
measure.description: Rate of decline of forced vital capacity (FVC) after bronchodilation. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing FVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing FVC

analysis.method_desc: Rate calculated as (measure on 30days after completion of treatment - measure on day 1 )/ years in between

outcome.title: Pre-bronchodilator Slow Vital Capacity (SVC) Rate of Decline From Day 1 to 30 Days After Completion of Double Blinded Treatment
outcome.description: Rate of decline slow vital capacity (SVC) before bronchodilation. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing SVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing SVC
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to 30 days after completion of double blinded treatment between Day 1 and 4 years plus 30 days

measure.title: Pre-bronchodilator Slow Vital Capacity (SVC) Rate of Decline From Day 1 to 30 Days After Completion of Double Blinded Treatment
measure.description: Rate of decline slow vital capacity (SVC) before bronchodilation. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing SVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing SVC

analysis.method_desc: Rate calculated as (measure on 30days after completion of treatment - measure on day 1 )/ years in between

outcome.title: Post-bronchodilator Slow Vital Capacity (SVC) Rate of Decline From Day 1 to 30 Days After Completion of Double Blinded Treatment
outcome.description: Rate of decline of slow vital capacity (SVC) after bronchodilation. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing SVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing SVC
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to 30 days after completion of double blinded treatment between Day 1 and 4 years plus 30 days

measure.title: Post-bronchodilator Slow Vital Capacity (SVC) Rate of Decline From Day 1 to 30 Days After Completion of Double Blinded Treatment
measure.description: Rate of decline of slow vital capacity (SVC) after bronchodilation. A negative rate of decline indicates decreasing SVC over time, while a positive value indicates increasing SVC

analysis.method_desc: Rate calculated as (measure on 30days after completion of treatment - measure on day 1 )/ years in between

outcome.title: Time to First Exacerbation
outcome.description: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) exacerbation

measure.title: Time to First Exacerbation
measure.description: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) exacerbation

analysis.estimate_desc: Median estimated by Kaplan-Meier estimates; hazard ratio shown as tio vs. placebo

outcome.title: Number of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Exacerbations Per Patient Year

measure.title: Number of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Exacerbations Per Patient Year

analysis.groups_desc: Poisson regression adjusted for overdispersion and treatment exposure
analysis.estimate_desc: Ratio calculated as estimated number of events in tio/number of events in placebo

outcome.title: Number and Percentage of Patients With at Least One Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Exacerbation

measure.title: Number and Percentage of Patients With at Least One Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Exacerbation

outcome.title: Number of Exacerbation Days Per Patient Year
outcome.description: Number of exacerbation days normalized by treatment exposure

measure.title: Number of Exacerbation Days Per Patient Year
measure.description: Number of exacerbation days normalized by treatment exposure

analysis.groups_desc: Poisson regression adjusted for overdispersion and treatment exposure
analysis.estimate_desc: Poisson regression adjusting for overdispersion with Pearson’s method adjusting for treatment exposure. The logarithm of treatment exposure is used as offset when building the Poisson model.

outcome.title: Time to First COPD Exacerbation Leading to Hospitalization (for 25% Patients)

measure.title: Time to First COPD Exacerbation Leading to Hospitalization (for 25% Patients)

outcome.title: Number and Percentage of Patients With at Least on COPD Exacerbation Leading to Hospitalization

measure.title: Number and Percentage of Patients With at Least on COPD Exacerbation Leading to Hospitalization

analysis.estimate_desc: Hazard ratio shown as tiotropium bromide vs. placebo

outcome.title: Number of Exacerbation Leading to Hospitalization
outcome.description: Estimated number of exacerbations leading to hospitalizations per patient year

measure.title: Number of Exacerbation Leading to Hospitalization
measure.description: Estimated number of exacerbations leading to hospitalizations per patient year

analysis.estimate_desc: Ratio of estimated number of events between tiotropium bromide and placebo

outcome.title: Days of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Exacerbation Leading to Hospitalization
outcome.description: Number of days with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) exacerbation leading to hospitalization (normalized by treatment exposure)

measure.title: Days of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Exacerbation Leading to Hospitalization
measure.description: Number of days with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) exacerbation leading to hospitalization (normalized by treatment exposure)

analysis.groups_desc: Poisson regression adjusting for overdispersion with Pearson’s method adjusting for treatment exposure. The logarithm of treatment exposure is used as offset when building the Poisson model.
analysis.estimate_desc: Ratio of estimated number of days of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) exacerbation leading to hospitalization between tio and placebo

outcome.title: Estimated St George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Total Score at Month 6
outcome.description: SGRQ total score summarizes the impact of COPD on overall patient's health status. Total scores are expressed as a percentage of overall impairment where 100 represents worst possible health status and 0 indicates best possible health status. The scale is continuous. Rate of decline shows the yearly change of SGRQ total score.

measure.description: SGRQ total score summarizes the impact of COPD on overall patient's health status. outcome.title: Number and Percentage of Participants With All Cause Death and Time to Event Analysis (On-treatment)
outcome.description: On-treatment defined as day 1 to completion of double blinded treatment plus 30 days
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to completion of double blinded treatment plus 30 days between Day 1 and 4 years plus 30 days

measure.title: Number and Percentage of Participants With All Cause Death and Time to Event Analysis (On-treatment)
measure.description: On-treatment defined as day 1 to completion of double blinded treatment plus 30 days

class.title: Number of patients with on-treatment death

analysis.estimate_desc: Cox regression with treatment; hazard ratio shown as tiotropium bromide vs. placebo

outcome.title: Number and Percentage of Participants With All Cause Death (Including Vital Status Follow-up, Cutoff at 1440 Days)

measure.title: Number and Percentage of Participants With All Cause Death (Including Vital Status Follow-up, Cutoff at 1440 Days)

class.title: Number of patients died from day 1 to day 1440
Percentage of patients died from day 1 to day 1440

analysis.groups_desc: Hazard ratio of all cause mortality vital status was information followed-up after discontinuation; vital status information up to 1440 days after the start of treatment was used
analysis.estimate_desc: Cox regression; cut-off at 4 years ; vital status form intended at 4 years; hazard ratio shown as tio vs. placebo

outcome.title: Number and Percentage of Participants With All Cause Death (Including Vital Status Follow-up, Cutoff at 1470 Days)
outcome.description: All cause mortality vital status information was followed-up after discontinuation; vital status information up to 1470 days after the start of treatment was used.

measure.title: Number and Percentage of Participants With All Cause Death (Including Vital Status Follow-up, Cutoff at 1470 Days)
measure.description: All cause mortality vital status information was followed-up after discontinuation; vital status information up to 1470 days after the start of treatment was used.

class.title: Number of patients died from day 1 to day 1470
Percentage of patients died from day 1 to day 1470

analysis.estimate_desc: Cox regression; cut-off at 4 years plus 30 days; vital status form intended at 4 years; hazard ratio shown as tio vs. placebo

outcome.title: Number and Percentage of Participants With Lower Respiratory Death (On-treatment; Adjudicated Primary Cause)
outcome.description: The primary cause of death was adjudicated by an external committee prior to unblinding; on-treatment defined as day 1 to completion of double blinded treatment plus 30 days
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to completion of double blinded treatment plus 30 days between Day 1 and 4 years plus 30 days

measure.title: Number and Percentage of Participants With Lower Respiratory Death (On-treatment; Adjudicated Primary Cause)
measure.description: The primary cause of death was adjudicated by an external committee prior to unblinding; on-treatment defined as day 1 to completion of double blinded treatment plus 30 days

class.title: Number of patients with lower respiratory
Percentage of patients with lower respiratory

analysis.estimate_desc: Cox regression with treatment; hazard ratio shown as tiotropium bromide vs. placebo

outcome.title: Number and Percentage of Participants With a Lower Respiratory Death (Adjudicated; Including Vital Status Follow-up, Cutoff at 1470 Days)
outcome.description: The primary cause of death was adjudicated by an external committee prior to unblinding; vital status was information followed-up after discontinuation; vital status information up to 1470 days after the start of treatment was used

measure.title: Number and Percentage of Participants With a Lower Respiratory Death (Adjudicated; Including Vital Status Follow-up, Cutoff at 1470 Days)
measure.description: The primary cause of death was adjudicated by an external committee prior to unblinding; vital status was information followed-up after discontinuation; vital status information up to 1470 days after the start of treatment was used

class.title: Number of patients with lower respiratory death
Percentage patients with lower respiratory death

analysis.estimate_desc: Cox regression; cut-off at 4 years plus 30 days; vital status form intended at 4 years; hazard ratio shown as tiotropium bromide vs. placebo

outcome.title: Incidence Rate of Serious Adverse Event (System Organ Class = Cardiac Disorders)
outcome.description: Descriptive statistics show the number of patients with event, central tendency shows incidence rate. Incidence rate calculated as number of patients with event divided by at-risk years * 100.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to completion of double blinded treatment plus 30 days

measure.title: Incidence Rate of Serious Adverse Event (System Organ Class = Cardiac Disorders)
measure.description: Descriptive statistics show the number of patients with event, central tendency shows incidence rate. Incidence rate calculated as number of patients with event divided by at-risk years * 100.

class.title: Incidence rate (number of events/100 patient year)

analysis.method_desc: incidence rate = number of patients with event/ time at risk
analysis.estimate_desc: Rate ratio of incidence rates (tiotropium/placebo)

outcome.title: Incidence Rate of Serious Adverse Event (Preferred Term = Angina)
outcome.description: Descriptive statistics show the number of patients with event, central tendency shows incidence rate. Incidence rate calculated as number of patients with event divided by at-risk years * 100.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to completion of double blinded treatment plus 30 days

measure.title: Incidence Rate of Serious Adverse Event (Preferred Term = Angina)
measure.description: Descriptive statistics show the number of patients with event, central tendency shows incidence rate. Incidence rate calculated as number of patients with event divided by at-risk years * 100.

analysis.estimate_desc: Rate ratio of incidence rates (tiotropium/placebo)

outcome.title: Incidence Rate of Serious Adverse Event (Preferred Term = Atrial Fibrillation)
outcome.description: Descriptive statistics show the number of patients with event, central tendency shows incidence rate. Incidence rate calculated as number of patients with event divided by at-risk years * 100.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to completion of double blinded treatment plus 30 days

measure.title: Incidence Rate of Serious Adverse Event (Preferred Term = Atrial Fibrillation)
measure.description: Descriptive statistics show the number of patients with event, central tendency shows incidence rate. Incidence rate calculated as number of patients with event divided by at-risk years * 100.

analysis.estimate_desc: Rate ratio of incidence rates (tiotropium/placebo)

outcome.title: Incidence Rate of Serious Adverse Event (Preferred Term = Cardiac Failure)
outcome.description: Descriptive statistics show the number of patients with event, central tendency shows incidence rate. Incidence rate calculated as number of patients with event divided by at-risk years * 100.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to completion of double blinded treatment plus 30 days

reported_events.time_frame: From first drug administration until 30 days after last drug administration
reported_events.desc: The Dictionary used to report the adverse events is Sponsor-defined based on the MedDRA version 11.0

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Carcinoid tumour of the small bowel
Mental disorder due to a general medical condition
Large cell carcinoma of the respir. tract stage unspecified
Lung carcinoma cell type unspecified recurrent
Lung carcinoma cell type unspecified stage 0
Lung carcinoma cell type unspecified stage III
Lung squamous cell carcinoma stage III
Lung squamous cell carcinoma stage IV
Lung squamous cell carcinoma stage unspecified
Small cell lung cancer extensive stage
Small cell lung cancer limited stage
Small cell lung cancer stage unspecified

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Tio patients had significantly longer drug exposure,thus had increased chance of AE.Simple frequencies are biased for AE comparisons;exposure-adjusted incidence rates (IR) should be used. IR for serious AE(>1% patients) are in Outcome Measures.
